titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to Doris Vivian Wilson papers SSC.MS.00650
titlestmt.author: Ellice Amanna

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-06-20 10:12:09 -0400.

change.item: This record was migrated from InMagic DB Textworks to ArchivesSpace.
Finding aid updated to current standards and published

did.abstract: Doris Vivian Wilson worked for many years for the YWCA of Metropolitan Chicago, and was the first African American executive of that organization.This collection includes awards, photograph of unidentified African American woman under a YWCA of Metropolitan Chicago poster, primitive wood carving, paper parasol, and oher memorabelia.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Doris Vivian Wilson worked for many years for the YWCA of Metropolitan Chicago, and was the first African American executive of that organization.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Doris Vivian Wilson papers, SSC-MS-00650, Sophia Smith Collection, Smith College, Northampton, Mass.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes awards, photograph of unidentified African American woman under a YWCA of Metropolitan Chicago poster, primitive wood carving, paper parasol, and oher memorabelia.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be governed by copyright. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. Researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The source of aquisition of this collection is unknown.
